snippet: Representative Edolphus Towns, a 15-term Democrat who was first elected to Congress in 1982, was facing a strong primary challenge in his Brooklyn district from Assemblyman Hakeem Jeffries.
abstract: Insiders report that Rep Edolphus Towns, Democrat of Brooklyn, will not seek a 16th term in Congress; Towns was facing a vigorous primary challenge in Brooklyn's 10th Congressional District from Assemblyman Hakeem Jeffries.
lead_paragraph: Representative Edolphus Towns, a 15-term Democrat who was first elected to Congress in 1982, was facing a strong primary challenge in his Brooklyn district from Assemblyman Hakeem Jeffries.

headline.seo: Edolphus Towns Is Said to Decline to Run Again for Congress
headline.main: Towns Is Said to Decline to Run Again for Congress
headline.print_headline: Towns Is Said to Decline to Run Again for Congress
